item.title: allies' war options may be limited in libya
item.description: the top commander of the allied air war to protect civilians in libyan cities said moammar gadhafi's forces must pull out or face attack.

item.title: uk immigrant screening misses most latent tb
item.description: british tuberculosis screening for new immigrants fails to detect most imported cases of latent disease and screening should be widened to include more people from the indian subcontinent, scientists said on thursday.

item.title: redskins' haynesworth charged with sexual abuse
item.description: washington redskins defensive lineman albert haynesworth was charged tuesday with misdemeanor sexual abuse for allegedly fondling the breast of his server in a hotel restaurant in washington.

item.title: the rail: a jockey's view of the derby
item.description: with the help of trakus, which uses global positioning technology to keep track of every horse in a race, viewers can simulate what it was like for john velazquez as he rode animal kingdom to victory in the kentucky derby on saturday.

item.title: iea warns oil price rally may lead to global slowdown
item.description: sky-high oil prices are beginning to dent oil demand growth, the international energy agency said on tuesday, but added prices could ultimately moderate through a global economic slowdown.

item.title: starbucks plans health and wellness strategy: ceo
item.description: starbucks corp will unveil its new health and wellness strategy "at some point in the future," chief executive howard schultz said on a webcast on monday.

item.title: fed's lockhart doesn't think price surge will last
item.description: the u.s. economy is on track for a sustained recovery but remains sufficiently weak to warrant the help of loose monetary policy, atlanta federal reserve president dennis lockhart said on monday.

item.title: apple secures licensing deals ahead of icloud unveiling
item.description: just days ahead of its planned unveiling of its icloud service, apple has succeeded in securing licensing deals from all four major labels and music publishers.

item.description: north carolina officials say five people were killed when a sport utility vehicle overturned on a national forest road and sank in a canal.

item.title: heartburn drugs offer little asthma relief: study
item.description: if you have asthma, your doctor might have you on heartburn drugs to ease your wheezing. but that's not necessarily a good idea, according to a fresh look at the medical evidence.

item.description: in the fight for influence between saudi arabia and iran, the united states may end up the loser.

item.description: restrictions on student visa were announced in the wake of concerns that they provided an easy route into britain for those seeking to sidestep stringent immigration controls.

item.title: iran backs arab uprisings unless pro-u.s.: khamenei

item.description: osama bin laden and his comrades offered no resistance when killed by u.s. special forces in a pakistani town, pakistani security officials said on thursday.

item.title: kissel will not appeal hk "milkshake murder" conviction: lawyer
item.description: an american woman convicted of murder by a hong kong jury last month will not appeal the ruling, her lawyer said on thursday, likely bringing to a close the long-running case over the killing of her merrill lynch banker husband in 2003.
